question: Question_01_(c)
statement:
If

\begin{align*}\displaystyle F(x) = \int_{0}^{x^{2}}f(t)\, dt,\end{align*}

where $\displaystyle f$ is a function satisfying
$\displaystyle f(4) = 1$, compute $\displaystyle F'(2).$
hints:
Apply the fundmental theorem of calculus to the integral

\begin{align*}\quad \int_{0}^{x^{2}}f(t)\,dt.\end{align*}
